programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: NFL Fantasy Live
programme.desc: Millions of NFL fans live in a fantasy world where survival depends on successfully navigating the twists and turns of a grueling season. After all, relying on a second-string quarterback or an untested wide receiver to come up big is usually foolhardy. Avoiding such predicaments takes plenty of preparation, and that's where "NFL Fantasy Live" comes into play. Host Marcas Grant provides the advice and analysis fantasy fans need to make winning lineup decisions. And being armed with the latest player updates, stats and trends goes a long way toward turning fantasies into championships.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.desc: A man who believed his life was going in the right direction is faced with a decision to either betray the woman he loves or turn on his best friend.

Faced with the challenge of wanting both a professional and a personal life, they realize that life at the top can at times be isolating, and require sacrificing the authority and control they've earned professionally.

programme.title: Dangerous Affair
programme.desc: Erika ends an affair with a man in her apartment building but the man has other plans.

programme.title: Counterplot
programme.desc: Hiding out in Puerto Rico from a murder rap and double-crossing lawyer in New York, Brock Miller Brock concocts a plan to catch the real killer.

programme.title: Clutch
programme.desc: In this dark comedy, a reluctant thief, Martyn (David Hewlett), inadvertently kills a man during the bungled robbery of a rare book. Martyn enlists his friends to get rid of the body, while he delivers the book to a psychotic black market antique dealer. When his car breaks down, he meets Theresa (Tanya Allen), a local mechanic, who tums out to be the girlfriend of the man he has just slain.

programme.title: Lines of Allegiance
programme.desc: After running a criminal enterprise for years, Professa feels it's time for a change. When he's set up by someone in his crew, he's arrested and sent out of Macon, GA per the judge's order. But when tragedy forces him to return, he finds the people he once cared for, have their own intentions for themselves.

programme.title: Cut
programme.desc: A claustrophobic thrill ride, only relenting on its increasingly unbearable tension and heart stopping shocks, to inject a little humor to soften the blow and increase the fun!

programme.title: Smoke Break
programme.desc: A barber and his crew work together to save their shop after another ordinary day on the job is suddenly sent off course by a robbery.

programme.title: The Special Affect
programme.desc: Expecting mother and artist, Destiny, spirals after a tragic loss. Her loving husband helps her cope, but a bad trip and missed meds spark disturbing memories. With the help of her best friend, Destiny uncovers a horrifying truth about her past.

programme.title: The Saved and the Salacious
programme.desc: Ashton, Isaac, and Terrell aim for gospel music fame, but clash with Titan Records' shady founder, Rodney.

programme.title: The Queens Court
programme.desc: An all-female underground organization rules every criminal activity in the city, and nothing can be done without their approval. Those who fail to comply are dealt with, by any means necessary.

programme.title: The Housekeeper 2
programme.desc: After moving on from her sordid past, Sharease flourishes in her new life and success. When her son Adonis kidnapped, she seeks help from a ghost of her past to rescue him.

programme.title: Trapped in the Game
programme.desc: Polo is a young desperate hustler looking to make some quick cash. However, the only way he knows how to make cash quickly, is pimping out young women with the help of his crew. When of his crew starts taking girls off the street, the heat threatens to bring down his whole operation.

programme.title: Back and Forth
programme.desc: Two people who love skating meet and fall for each other. But one hides something that could destroy their relationship and break hearts.

programme.title: Three
programme.desc: As a birthday gift, a man asks his fiancée for a threesome with her friend, which leads to heartbreak and jealousy in their relationship.

programme.title: Tilt
programme.desc: Nia, raised in a dysfunctional household, has a chance to stepout of her mother's shadow when she is introduced to the game of pinball.

programme.title: Till Death Do Us 2
programme.desc: The fates of Tamara, TJ, and even Marcus himself hang in the balance after the bloody kitchen shooting. Meanwhile, Jessica, TJ's ex-wife, faces scrutiny for her past actions and the future of their children. With the threat of child protective services looming, the clock is ticking to find answers and rebuild shattered lives.

programme.title: Carmen and Magic
programme.desc: When Carmen meets a new friend at school named Magic, she helps raise her spirits and allows her to stand up for herself. When her single father Drew starts seeing the school principal, Magic convinces Carmen to disrupt their relationship, pulling the veil on Magic's sinister nature.

programme.title: Bloodlines
programme.desc: Sydney Carter is a restless college student that has always felt out of place. When she discovers she's adopted, her world beings to unravel, and she embarks on a journey to discover her origins, but they come at a cost, and could destroy everything she's ever known.

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: After serving a prison sentence, farmer Matt Calder (Robert Mitchum) returns to his 19th-century Pacific Northwest gold rush town and retrieves his adolescent son, Mark (Tommy Rettig). Meanwhile, goodhearted barroom singer Kay (Marilyn Monroe) is heading downriver with her boyfriend, Harry (Rory Calhoun), to explore a potential gold claim. When their raft sinks, Harry robs Matt of his gun and horse to continue without Kay on land. Sailing downriver toward the claim, the trio plan their revenge.

programme.title: The First Texan
programme.desc: Having left his post as governor of Tennessee, Gen. Sam Houston (Joel McCrea) resettles in Mexican territory along the southwest U.S. border. He soon sets his sights on reclaiming the land under the aegis of Texas independence, while romancing post-divorce new love interest Katherine Delaney (Felicia Farr). His efforts eventually lead to the historic Battle of San Jacinto and a very clever bit of battlefield strategy by Houston in his fight against forces led by Gen. Santa Anna.

As the community awaits a sweep of trail herds coming from Texas, Honest John Barrett (Robert Middleton), the shady owner of the town saloon, plots to have Silver killed. Things get even worse when Thad Anderson (Jeffrey Hunter), the son of a hired gun killed by Silver years earlier in self-defense, arrives in town.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: The Hired Gun

Regardless, McCord is a professional and so captures her, prepared to hand her over. Accused of murdering her husband, Ellen vehemently insists that she is not the killer. After some initial resistance, McCord buys her story and the two go on a hunt to bring the real assassin to justice.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Cattle rustling leads to canceling a contract to supply beef for railroad construction crews. Matt has to stop the cattle rustlers or the railroad construction will be stopped.

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.desc: Nicole goes through the wringer with dating, until she meets her childhood crush: celebrity Michael Vartan. Will he break her unlucky-in-love streak?

programme.desc: Dana Gould takes on the absurdities of modern life through a pop-culture obsessed lens. Unapologetic and off-the-wall funny, there's no middle ground in this comedy special filmed at the Neptune Theater in Seattle, WA.

programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.desc: The comic performs for an audience consisting of only her parents.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whether there is a heatwave or a downpour, Monty has plenty of jobs to be getting on with from pruning, propagating or planting pots. Adam Frost meets Prince Charles in his garden at Highgrove to talk about the issue of biosecurity, an issue which is of great concern to him and which could have a big effect on our gardens and landscape. Adam also talks to The Prince's Head Forester to find out what gardeners can do to help.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of the snowdrop, with a visit one of the world's largest collections, lovingly nurtured in a suburban back garden. Plus, Monty gives tips on what to do once they have finished flowering. Nick Bailey revels in the beauty of magnolias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar: the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out annuals in the jewel garden, adds agapanthus to the mound and finds a new home for his pelargoniums. Adam Frost visits an innovative kitchen garden at the Spurs training centre in North London, which provides fresh produce for its players, coaches and staff. In Wiltshire, Carol Klein's at a glorious early summer garden which employs clever use of curves, circles and spheres in its evergreen planting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out sweetcorn, checks in on his container veg and creates a display with fuchsias. Nick Bailey visits a nurserywoman and gardener in Cheshire who uses perennials as the stars of the garden to provide interest throughout the year. With only a few weeks to go, Sue Kent shares an update on the progress of her first ever show garden, destined for the Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. And there's a gardener in Somerset who couldn't live without roses in her garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Joe Swift reveal the highlights of the show gardens, meet the designers and growers and share the season's must have flowers and plants on display.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into some seasonal jobs. Arit Anderson and Nick Bailey present highlights from RHS Flower Show Tatton Park, and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to deal with drought, takes fuchsia cuttings and demonstrates how to summer prune fruit trees. Advolly Richmond reveals the important role that trees have played in gardens throughout history on a visit to Longleat. There's also a catch-up with three sisters in Dorset who developed a love of gardening during lockdown, this time, they plant up two beds, one for sun and one for shade.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty sows rocket, harvests chillies and tomatoes, and demonstrates how to take semi-ripe cuttings. Frances Tophill meets a head gardener in south London who's started gardening sustainably.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Pure Hunting

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: Spring Thunder heads North to turkey hunt New York State. Using their OnX maps to secure turkey hunting ground, the guys are able to double up on two New York Longbeards!!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Filming your own bow hunts can be challenging. Throw in some crazy rut chaos and it can be just about impossible. Bouncing around in a Summit climber proved to be a deadly tactic for Bryan Brown as he was able to get tight to the bedding area where 5 bucks were chasing 1 hot doe.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Lone Star State of Mind

programme.title: Gloria

programme.title: Finding Graceland

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: Everything changes for a bored bank teller who hates everything about his life the day two different gangs of bank robbers bust through the door.

programme.title: Wilder Napalm
programme.desc: Sparks fly when two brothers, a workaday joe and a circus performer, who possess pyrokinetic minds, start fires and vie for the love of one hot woman.

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man before it is too late.

programme.title: Family Business
programme.desc: A Westinghouse scholar recruits his criminal grandpa and reformed criminal dad to steal plasma from a research lab and share in the $1 million reward.

programme.title: Robot and Frank
programme.desc: An aging, cantankerous ex-cat burglar finds his zest for life renewed when he trains his robotic caretaker to help him commit heists.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
programme.desc: During World War II, feuding leaders train British recruits for a risky covert mission to blow up a giant battleship in an enemy-held French port.

programme.title: 711 Ocean Drive
programme.desc: A phone company repairman bites off more than he can chew when he agrees to create a system that broadcasts race track results for a crime boss.

programme.title: In the French Style
programme.desc: A young American travels to Paris to become an artist. Swept up in a series of affairs, she must decide whether to stay or return home to get married.

programme.title: Decameron Nights
programme.desc: While trying to woo a noblewoman in Florence, Italian poet Boccaccio tells three tales of love in this romance based on the author's writings.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Terror Trail
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) heads off a range war over cattle and sheep.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Count Three and Pray
programme.desc: After fighting for the Union during the Civil War, Luke Fargo (Van Heflin) is greeted with resentment when he returns home to his small southern town. Luke has a reputation as a rogue, but he's reinvented himself as a man of God and plans to fix up the town's damaged church. Recalling their romantic past, Georgina Decrais (Allison Hayes) tries to reclaim Luke. But, to the dismay of some suspicious townspeople, he concentrates on mentoring an unsophisticated young woman, Lissy (Joanne Woodward).

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law
programme.desc: After Tim Clark's ranch is stolen by Bob Russell, he discovers that the crook is also trying to cheat his lover out of her land.

programme.title: Dirty Little Billy
programme.desc: After his family moves to a frontier town in Kansas, city-bred teenager Billy Bonney (Michael J. Pollard) finds he has no appetite for farming. He runs away, taking up with local outlaw Goldie (Richard Evans), who operates a saloon in town with the help of a prostitute named Berle (Lee Purcell). The three form a gang of sorts, menacing the locals until the townsfolk collectively decide to drive the outlaws away. Bonney escapes and begins the life of crime that makes him famous as Billy the Kid.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.desc: Danny Koker restores a 1969 Shelby GT500 numbers-matching car from a rust bucket into an instant classic. The team visits the Detroit Autorama.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Inspired by the Rat Rods at a local shop, Danny sends the guys out to find parts for a Count's Kustoms Rat Rod.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin's brother Steve wants a 1980 Kawasaki KZ100 motorcycle tricked out just like the ones on the classic TV series, CHiPs.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny takes on his most emotional project yet after spotting a 70 Dodge Challenger on a private road.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny scores a 1967 Mustang that he hopes he can turn into another Count's Kustoms masterpiece. He visits a local muscle car collection for inspiration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After nearly thirty years, Danny decides it's finally time to restore his late father's rare 1982 Mercedes Benz 500 SEC AMG, the way he would have wanted to.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the vehicle holding a land speed record, The Turbinator, blew a tire at 400 MPH last year, some serious damage was done.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the gang head to the Las Vegas Speedway for Ford Mustang's 50th Anniversary Celebration.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan, Mike and Shannon convince Danny to sponsor them in a 24-hour endurance race called The LeMons.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: This two-part episode starts with a client asking Danny to find and build a 1979 Camaro Z28, to commemorate the first car he ever owned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a last-minute change of heart and can't let go of a classic car he promised to sell to a loyal customer.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Chevys and Fords strive to break past six figures on the auction block as various vehicles sell for no reserve at the World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Exploring which model and year a "million-dollar Corvette" came from.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Fords, Pontiacs, Chevys, and Porsches go head to head as bidders go dollar for dollar trying to get the best deals on the finest vehicles in sunny Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson closes off its celebration with the best collector cars Scottsdale, Ariz., has to offer; they prove just why they were able to make it 50 years in the game.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Super Saturday is in full swing at the Las Vegas auction as a '59 Cadillac reproduction Ectomobile from "Ghostbusters" takes center stage; fitted out with operational ghostbusting equipment, Ecto-1 crashes its way into the top 10 sellers list.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Texas gives a history lesson as cars like the Ford Phaeton four-door convertible come across the auction block, showing car lovers just how far things are from horses and buggies.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Mike Joy looks through the differences between a resto mod and a custom.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle is far from over as logging's toughest season winds down; Jesse questions the future of the family business; rumors of a pullout abound for the Gustafson crew; the Pihl crew celebrates a good year; a Stump Branch logger quits.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As dawn breaks over the Pacific Northwest, this year's Ax Men prepare for the battle that lies ahead. Behind every turn, danger lurks.

programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin is excited to see a straight '63 Impala with a four speed and legendary 409 engine under the hood; the owner wants to keep it original with the main mods under the body, new frame, suspension and big wheels.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A new customer, comes into the shop with an exceptional 1963 Cadillac; this car screams luxury but needs an upgrade; with Shane giving the MBC team creative freedom on the build, Joe gets to work on a plan; new engine, new wheels and a new interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Return customer Lee Farris comes to Martin Bros with a 1956 Chevy Bel Air, his first car that he wants to bring back to life; the first thing Joe notices is the outdated flame paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe makes a high-risk move and chops the top off of a 1950 Mercury coupe.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With the 1950 Mercury successfully chopped, the rest of the work can begin; the MBC team now has to marry the old roof with the new geometry of the newly chopped body; there are angles everywhere and they are all out of whack.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and his crew are always under the gun, but their latest build, a '71 Nova, is well behind schedule and they have a ton of work to do; Joe is really going to town on the metal work on this car, inside and out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Facing deadline, the shop struggles to fit a gigantic ex-NFL player into a tiny 1967 Chevy C10 that includes a customized leather interior and automated bed cover.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.desc: Shag and Amanda get a '65 Chevy II Nova for a steal, but as the team digs in, rat nests and rust are the least of their worries; the build requires a complete overhaul and has them thinking they bit off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Working for a bondswoman friend, Mary Ellen, Dog and his team hunt Chris, a fugitive wanted on drug charges. Dog turns over every rock, but to no avail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't know it yet, but today's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Michael is out on bail for drug sales, theft, and violation of parole. Dog's after him for failing to appear in court and his only lead is Jen, his co-signer and girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and today they face a special Chapman challenge--getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for aggravated car theft, but she's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Wisconsin, a varsity athlete is blindfolded, gagged, and shoved into a van by four gunmen. The kidnappers contact the victim's family and demand $30,000, but offer no instructions on how to transfer the money. The victim's family contacts the police. The boy's captors tell his family they have shot him, and will kill him if they do not receive their money. At an agreed upon drop site, FBI agents approach the captor's vehicle, only to watch them flee and quickly be followed by authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, Washington, D.C. police were losing the battle against street gangs who enforced their territories with lethal violence. The homicide rate in the nation's capital climbed to the highest in the country. Local police turned to the FBI for help, but agents soon found themselves in the direct line of fire. In the fall of 1994, a gang member walked into police headquarters, killed two FBI agents and one detective, then turned the gun on himself.

programme.title: Los archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rutgers freshman Tyler Clementi and Dharun Ravi had only been roommates for few weeks when Ravi decided to secretly film Tyler kissing another man; soon after, Clementi took his own life and Ravi faced surprising criminal charges.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: The murders of Voncile Smith and her sons John and Richard set Pensacola, Florida on edge; the courts try to decide if this was an occult ritual or something much more basic: greed.

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A couple's vacation plans are thwarted when they find out their flight is canceled; they return home to find their house taken over by intruders.

programme.title: Forensic Justice
programme.desc: Pablo Escobar is the drug kingpin of the world. He is the most successful criminal the underworld has ever seen. Plus, a scam artist goes from aviation entrepreneur to managing and ripping off boy bands like Backstreet Boys and ‘NSYNC.

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A rogue broker's unauthorized speculative trading causes Barings Bank to collapse; Tour de France winner Lance Armstrong is accused of doping.

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A scam artist rips off famous boy bands; the drug kingpin of the world.

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: New York's "Preppy Murder"; a union's benefits manager steals more than $40 million and leaves the retirees broke.

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: A group of celebrity-obsessed teens breaks into the homes of Hollywood stars, stealing millions of dollars; Ephren Taylor urges the faithful to give back to God through his various investments.

programme.title: VPI: Vinnie Politan Investigates
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Opening Statements With Julie Grant
programme.desc: Former prosecutor Julie Grant is joined by a team of top trial attorneys and forensic experts to cover the high-stakes trials that are on the docket, and the crime cases dominating the headlines.

programme.title: Court TV LIVE

programme.desc: A killer who goaded police and media during his spree, Heriberto Seda claimed to kill based on his victims' star signs.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Richard Kuklinski claims to have murdered over 100 people for New York and New Jersey's crime families.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: In 2007, single mother of three Paige Birgfeld goes missing.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The chilling story of Lee Ford, who killed his wife and four stepchildren in a murder spree.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Jordan Monaghan kills his 24-day-old daughter Ruby on New Year's Day in January 2013.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: When Carol Jarvis disappears, her husband tells friends and family that she's simply gone on a little holiday.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of the 23-year-old killer who murdered 17-year-old former head girl Georgia Williams in 2013.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A master manipulator accused of his wife's murder is eventually caught by a polygraph test.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
